name: Toot
author: Justin Tadlock

sections.description:
Toot creates a new type of content called a “Testimonial” on your WordPress install. This is useful if you have products or services and need to showcase your testimonials in some way.

Features

  • Testimonials: Create individual testimonials.
  • Categories: Categorize testimonials.
  • Testimonial Details: Add details such as a URL, author email, and image.
  • Custom Permalinks: Customize your testimonial permalinks to your own liking.
  • Sticky Testimonials: Stick testimonials to the top of the testimonial archive.

For more info, visit the Toot plugin home page.

sections.installation:
1. Upload toot to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory.
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress.
  3. Go to “Testimonials > Settings” to select which settings you’d like to use.

More detailed instructions are included in the plugin’s readme.html file.
sections.faq:
Installation Instructions

  1. Upload toot to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory.
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress.
  3. Go to “Testimonials > Settings” to select which settings you’d like to use.

More detailed instructions are included in the plugin’s readme.html file.

Why was this plugin created?

I’ve used the underlying code for this plugin for many years on my own site. I figured it was time to simply package it up into a release for the public.

How do I use it?

Most things should be fairly straightforward, but I’ve included an in-depth guide in the plugin download. It’s a file called readme.md in the plugin folder.

You can also view the readme online.
sections.changelog: The change log is located in the changelog.md file in the plugin folder. You may also view the change log online.
